the transformation of the CIA and AmericaÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s special operations forces

the new American way of war.

The most momentous change in American warfare over the past decade 
has taken place away from the battlefields of Afghanistan and Iraq, 
in the corners of the world where large armies canÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t go. The Way of 
the Knife is the untold story of that shadow war: a campaign that has 
blurred the lines between soldiers and spies and lowered the bar for 
waging war across the globe. America has pursued its enemies with 
killer drones and special operations troops; trained privateers for 
assassination missions and used them to set up clandestine 
spying networks; and relied on mercurial dictators, untrustworthy 
foreign intelligence services, and proxy armies.
